stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: US Financial Institution Spoofed in Phishing Email
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description: On 18 July 2014, a US financial institution was spoofed in a phishing email. The email contained a suspicious link and had the subject "Bank Of America Alerts : You Have A New Message". Open source reports indicate that the domain hosted what appeared to be a banking fake login page.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description: -----Begin Email Body-----From: Bank Of America [mailto:OnlineBanking_eAlerts@bankofamerica.sltid.com] Sent: Friday, July 18, 2014 1:43 PMTo: [REDACTED]Subject: Bank Of America Alerts : You Have A New Message Dear Customer, You have a new message waiting for you in your secure message center. Please click the link below to read now,https://www3-bofa.com/myAlerts Thanks Bank of America-----End Email Body-----

EmailMessageObj:Header.EmailMessageObj:Subject: Bank Of America Alerts : You Have A New Message

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description: Suspicious URL contained in the email body. Open source reports indicate that on 18 July 2014, this domain resolved to the IP 185.45.192.210.
